TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ControlType extends System.Windows.Automation.AutomationIdentifier

Docs.summary: Identifies the type of a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)] control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks ControlType inherits from <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationIdentifier> and is used to identify the type of a control represented by an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement>. The control type is determined by the developer of the UI Automation provider.
This class contains static fields, which are themselves ControlType objects, to identify the standard types of controls. There is also a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Custom> type for controls that do not match one of the defined types.
The only case where a control's control type might change at run time is where the control supports <xref:System.Windows.Automation.MultipleViewPattern>. An example is the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_win32](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-win32-md.md)] list view, which can be a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.DataGrid> or <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.List>, depending on the current view.
Control types do not have a one-to-one equivalence to control patterns. A control can be of only one type, but it may support multiple patterns or no patterns at all, depending on its specific functionality.
For detailed information on the various control types, see [UI Automation Control Types](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Button

Docs.summary: Identifies a button control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Buttons perform a single action when clicked.
A button can be used as a standalone control or as a subcontrol in another control type. For example, the drop-down arrow in a combo box control is a button. When used as a subcontrol, a button is in the control view of the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] tree (not in the content view).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Calendar

Docs.summary: Identifies a calendar control, such as a date-picker.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType CheckBox

Docs.summary: Identifies a check box control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A check box can be used as a standalone control or as a subcontrol in another control type. For example, a check box at the beginning of a row in a grid control that is used to select the row (used to manipulate the content) appears in the control view but not in the content view. However, a labeled checkbox in a form that represents data is in the content and control views.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType ComboBox

Docs.summary: Identifies a combo box control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks There are two variations of combo box controls. A simple combo box presents a list that a user can select from. An editable combo box presents a list of choices and also has an editable text area where a user can type in a choice instead of being limited to selecting from the choices in the list.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Custom

Docs.summary: Identifies a control that is not one of the defined control types.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Custom control type indicates a control that is not identified as one of the predefined control types (such as <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> or <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType>).
Control developers should check the other control types before designating their control as a Custom control type to be sure that their control does not provide the same functionality as one of the defined control types.
A Custom control type requires extra work for the provider to implement [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)]. Also, UI Automation client products will not be able to anticipate the control structure, keyboard interaction, and possible control patterns based on the control type of the control.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType DataGrid

Docs.summary: Identifies a data grid control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When the cells contain only text, the control type should be <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType DataItem

Docs.summary: Identifies a data item control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A DataItem is a complex item that can contain many other controls.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Document

Docs.summary: Identifies a document control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A document contains text content of more than one line.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Edit

Docs.summary: Identifies an edit control, such as a text box.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An Edit control can be used as a standalone control or as a subcontrol in another control type. For example, the area where a user can type in a value in a combo box control is an Edit control, and in this case the control is not part of the content view.
Edit controls can also represent controls that contain passwords. The <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.AutomationElementInformation.IsPassword%2A> property enables products such as screen readers to know whether to reveal the contents.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Automation.AutomationPattern[] GetNeverSupportedPatterns() cil managed

Docs.summary: Retrieves the pattern identifiers that are not supported by the control type.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is useful for UI Automation clients such as test frameworks for a provider implementation that need to find all control patterns that are not permitted on this control type.
## Examples The following example calls GetNeverSupportedPatterns on every kind of <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> contained as a static field in the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> class.
[!code-cs[UIAControlTypePatterns_snip#101](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/GetSupportedPatterns/GetPatternsForm.cs#101)] [!code-vb[UIAControlTypePatterns_snip#101](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/getsupportedpatterns/getpatternsform.vb#101)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Automation.AutomationPattern[][] GetRequiredPatternSets() cil managed

Docs.summary: Retrieves an array of sets of required patterns.
Docs.returns: An array of sets of required patterns.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each element of the array contains an array of patterns, and each element that has this control type must support at least one of these arrays.
This method is useful for UI Automation clients that need to find all possible patterns, such as testing frameworks for a provider implementation.
## Examples The following example calls GetRequiredPatternSets on every kind of <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> contained as a static field in the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> class.
[!code-cs[UIAControlTypePatterns_snip#101](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/GetSupportedPatterns/GetPatternsForm.cs#101)] [!code-vb[UIAControlTypePatterns_snip#101](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/getsupportedpatterns/getpatternsform.vb#101)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperty[] GetRequiredProperties() cil managed

Docs.summary: Retrieves an array of the required property [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_id#plural](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-idsharpplural-md.md)] for this control type.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is useful for UI Automation clients that need to find all possible properties, such as testing frameworks for a provider implementation.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Group

Docs.summary: Identifies a group control, which acts as a container for other controls.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A group is a container control that contains different control types and is used to logically associate those controls.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Header

Docs.summary: Identifies a header control, which is a container for the labels of rows and columns of information.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType HeaderItem

Docs.summary: Identifies a header item, which is the label for a row or column of information.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Hyperlink

Docs.summary: Identifies a hyperlink control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A hyperlink control navigates to a specified [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_url](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-url-md.md)] when a user clicks on the control.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Image

Docs.summary: Identifies an image control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An Image control type can be used as a standalone control or as a subcontrol in another control type. For example, a button can use an image rather than text to indicate its functionality to the user.
When used only for decorative purposes, an image appears in the control view of the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] tree (not in the content view).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType List

Docs.summary: Identifies a list control, such as a list box.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A List is a control type that contains <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> and (perhaps) <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> control types.
A List control can be used as a standalone control or as a subcontrol in another control type. For example, a combo box has a List control that contains choices that appear when the drop-down button is clicked. When used as a subcontrol, a List is only in the control view of the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] tree (not in content view).
When used as a subcontrol, a List does not have a `Name` property assigned.
A List can contain <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> controls.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType ListItem

Docs.summary: Identifies a list item control, which is a child item of a list control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> can also be a child of a list control.

Docs.summary: Gets a description of the control type.
Docs.value: A localized description of the control type, such as "button".

remarks.format:
## Examples In the following example, all control types are found by reflection, and their LocalizedControlType properties are output along with other information.
[!code-cs[UIAControlTypePatterns_snip#101](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/GetSupportedPatterns/GetPatternsForm.cs#101)] [!code-vb[UIAControlTypePatterns_snip#101](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/getsupportedpatterns/getpatternsform.vb#101)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType LookupById(int32 id) cil managed

Docs.summary: Retrieves a that encapsulates a specified numerical identifier.
Docs.returns: Retrieves a that encapsulates a specified numerical identifier.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Normally the type of a control is identified by a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> object. This method enables you to construct such an object when only the numerical identifier is known.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Menu

Docs.summary: Identifies a menu control, such as a top-level menu in an application window.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A menu is a container for a collection of menu items; for instance, the control that appears beneath **File** when you click on it and that contains **New**, **Open**, and so on.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType MenuBar

Docs.summary: Identifies a menu bar control, which generally contains a set of top-level menus.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A MenuBar control type represents the container for the set of top-level menus of an application.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType MenuItem

Docs.summary: Identifies a menu item control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A MenuItem is a child of a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> or <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> control.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Pane

Docs.summary: Identifies a pane control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A Pane is used to visually separate content within a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType>. The user typically navigates between panes by pressing TAB, F6, or CTRL+TAB, depending on the context.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType ProgressBar

Docs.summary: Identifies a progress bar control, which visually indicates the progress of a lengthy operation.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType RadioButton

Docs.summary: Identifies a radio button control, which is a selection mechanism allowing exactly one selected item in a group.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType ScrollBar

Docs.summary: Identifies a scroll bar control, such as a scroll bar in an application window.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A ScrollBar control type contains a set of buttons and a thumb control that enable a user using a mouse to scroll the contents of a window or item container.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.AutomationElementInformation.AutomationId%2A> property to differentiate between the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Button> elements that correspond to the large-increment, large-decrement, small-increment, and small-decrement buttons.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Separator

Docs.summary: Identifies a separator, which creates a visual division in controls like menus and toolbars.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Slider

Docs.summary: Identifies a slider control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A Slider control type consists of a set of buttons associated with an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> control that enable a user to select from a set of items or set a numerical value from within a range.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Spinner

Docs.summary: Identifies a spinner control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A Spinner control type consists of a set of buttons that enable a user to select from a set of items or set a numerical value from within a range.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType SplitButton

Docs.summary: Identifies a split button, which is a button that performs a default action and can also expand to a list of other possible actions.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType StatusBar

Docs.summary: Identifies a status bar control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks StatusBar control types are generally subcontrols of <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> control type [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] elements.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Tab

Docs.summary: Identifies a tab control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A Tab is a control type that contains at least one <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> child control.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType TabItem

Docs.summary: Identifies a tab item control, which represents a page of a tab control.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Table

Docs.summary: Identifies a table.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A Table control type is similar to a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> but contains only text. Tables can also contain <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> control types.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Text

Docs.summary: Identifies an edit control, such as a text box or rich text box.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A Text control can be used as a standalone control, such as an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> control, or as a subcomponent, such as the area of a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> where a user can type in a value.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Thumb

Docs.summary: Identifies the control in a scrollbar that can be dragged to a different position.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A Thumb control is used as a subcontrol in a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> control type. As a subcontrol, a Thumb does not have a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.NameProperty>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType TitleBar

Docs.summary: Identifies the caption bar on a window.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType ToolBar

Docs.summary: Identifies a toolbar, such as the control that contains a set of command buttons in an application window.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType ToolTip

Docs.summary: Identifies a tooltip control, an informational window that appears as a result of moving the pointer over a control or sometimes when tabbing to a control using the keyboard.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Tree

Docs.summary: Identifies a tree control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A Tree control type is a container for a hierarchical arrangement of <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> or <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> control types.
Each node of a tree can contain other nodes. A node that contains child nodes can be displayed as expanded or collapsed.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType TreeItem

Docs.summary: Identifies a node in a TreeItem control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A TreeItem control type can be used only as a subcontrol of a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType> control.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.ControlType Window

Docs.summary: Identifies a window frame, which contains child objects.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Controls of this type always support <xref:System.Windows.Automation.WindowPattern>.
